Description: Terracotta figure fragment. Head of woman wearing a festival wreath headdress. Mould-made and hollow. Red-brown Nile silt with grey core and abundant fine mica and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Published by Gutch (1899, no.166). Probably locally produced at Naukratis terracottas workshop that dates 3rd to the 2nd century BC. Parallel from Naukratis (Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology NA550). Similar piece from Tell Atrib dated to the 3rd century BC (Szymańska 2005, no.194). Szymańska, H. 2005, Terres cuites d’Athribis, Turnhout.
Bibliographic references: Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 91, no. 166, pl. XII, no. 166)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.448) (Phase 3)
